channel.title: Manage DevOps Projects on
channel.description: Recent content in Manage DevOps Projects on

item.title: Create DevOps Projects
item.description:
This section explains how to create DevOps projects.

Prerequisites

  • A workspace (not system-workspace) has been created.

  • You should join a workspace and have the DevOps Project Creation permission within the workspace. For more information, refer to "Workspace Members" and "Workspace Roles".

  • DevOps must have been installed and enabled.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the DevOps Project Creation permission, and access your workspace.

  2. Click DevOps Projects in the left navigation pane.

  3. On the DevOps Projects page, click Create.

  4. In the Create DevOps Project dialog, configure the parameters for the DevOps project and then click OK.

    Parameter Description

    Name

item.title: View DevOps Project List
item.description:
This section explains how to view the DevOps project list.

Prerequisites

  • You should join a workspace and have the DevOps Project Viewing permission within the workspace. For more information, refer to "Workspace Members" and "Workspace Roles".

  • DevOps must have been installed and enabled.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the DevOps Project Viewing permission, and access your workspace.

  2. Click DevOps Projects in the left navigation pane.

    • The DevOps project list provides the following information:

      Parameter Description

      Name

item.title: Edit DevOps Project Information
item.description:
This section explains how to edit project information.

You can edit the alias and description of a DevOps project. KubeSphere does not support editing the name of an already created DevOps project.

Prerequisites

  • You should join a workspace and have the DevOps Project Management permission within the workspace. For more information, refer to "Workspace Members" and "Workspace Roles".

  • DevOps must be installed and enabled.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the DevOps Project Management permission, and access your workspace.

  2. Click DevOps Projects in the left navigation pane.

  3. On the right side of the DevOps project you want to edit, click , and then select Edit Information from the dropdown list.

  4. In the Edit Information dialog, set the alias and description of the DevOps project, then click OK.

    Parameter Description

    Alias

item.title: Delete DevOps Projects
item.description:
This section explains how to delete DevOps projects.

Note

Once a DevOps project is deleted, it cannot be recovered, and all resources within the DevOps project will also be deleted. Please proceed with caution.

Prerequisites

  • You should join a workspace and have the DevOps Project Management permission within the workspace. For more information, refer to "Workspace Members" and "Workspace Roles".

  • DevOps must be installed and enabled.
